1.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, one who doesn’t enter by the door into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

2.text: But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.

4.text: Whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.

5.text: They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don’t know the voice of strangers.”

6.text: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn’t understand what he was telling them.

7.text: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Most certainly, I tell you, I am the sheep’s door.

8.text: All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.

9.text: I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.

10.text: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

11.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

12.text: He who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who doesn’t own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and flees. The wolf snatches the sheep, and scatters them.

13.text: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand, and doesn’t care for the sheep.

14.text: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I’m known by my own;

15.text: even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.text: I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. They will become one flock with one shepherd.

17.text: Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

18.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.”

19.text: Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words.

20.text: Many of them said, “He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?”

21.text: Others said, “These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn’t possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”

22.text: It was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem.

23.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

24.text: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him, “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”

25.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you don’t believe. The works that I do in my Father’s name, these testify about me.

26.text: But you don’t believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.

27.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

28.text: I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.

29.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father’s hand.

30.text: I and the Father are one.”

31.text: Therefore Jews took up stones again to stone him.

32.text: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?”

33.text: The Jews answered him, “We don’t stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.”

34.text: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’

35.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can’t be broken),

36.text: do you say of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’

37.text: If I don’t do the works of my Father, don’t believe me.

38.text: But if I do them, though you don’t believe me, believe the works; that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”

39.text: They sought again to seize him, and he went out of their hand.

40.text: He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and there he stayed.

41.text: Many came to him. They said, “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.”
